operations.command:
cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add infrastructure/analysis-templates/error-rate.yaml infrastructure/analysis-templates/success-rate.yaml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(03-01): upgrade error-rate and success-rate templates

- Add NaN/Inf handling with failureCondition for no-traffic scenarios
- Add parameterized prometheus-address arg for environment flexibility
- Change rate window from 1m to 5m for stability (>= 2x scrape interval)
- Add interval: 1m and count: 5 for better measurement coverage
- Add configurable threshold arg to success-rate template
- Update mock templates to match production args structure
EOF
)"
operations.description: Commit Task 1 - upgraded error-rate and success-rate templates
Validate YAML syntax for latency-p99 template

operations.command:
cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add infrastructure/analysis-templates/latency-p99.yaml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(03-01): create latency-p99 template

- Use histogram_quantile for accurate P99 (not avg which hides tail latency)
- Add configurable threshold-seconds arg (default 100ms)
- Add NaN/Inf handling for no-traffic scenarios
- Add parameterized prometheus-address for environment flexibility
- Include mock version with Job provider for testing
EOF
)"

cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && kubectl apply --dry-run=client -f infrastructure/analysis-templates/throughput.yaml && kubectl apply --dry-run=client -f infrastructure/analysis-templates/saturation-cpu.yaml && kubectl apply --dry-run=client -f infrastructure/analysis-templates/saturation-memory.yaml
operations.description: Validate YAML syntax for throughput, saturation-cpu, saturation-memory templates

operations.command:
cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add infrastructure/analysis-templates/throughput.yaml infrastructure/analysis-templates/saturation-cpu.yaml infrastructure/analysis-templates/saturation-memory.yaml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(03-01): create throughput, saturation-cpu, saturation-memory templates

- throughput: Measures RPS with configurable min-rps threshold (default 1)
- saturation-cpu: Measures CPU utilization vs limits (default 80% threshold)
- saturation-memory: Measures memory utilization vs limits (default 80% threshold)
- All templates have NaN/Inf handling for no-data scenarios
- All templates have parameterized prometheus-address
- All templates follow consistent structure: interval 1m, count 5, failureLimit 2
- Include mock versions with Job provider for testing
EOF
)"

strategy:
    canary:
      # Keep old ReplicaSet warm for 10 minutes after abort for fast rollbac...

operations.command:
cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add apps/demo/rollout-canary.yaml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(demo): add progressive SLO-based thresholds to canary rollout

Update demo canary rollout with 3-step progressive thresholds that
tighten as traffic increases:

- Step 1 (20%): Lenient - 10% error rate, 200ms P99 latency
- Step 2 (50%): Standard - 5% error rate, 150ms P99 latency
- Step 3 (80%): Strict - 2% error rate, 100ms P99 latency

Uses production ClusterAnalysisTemplates (error-rate, latency-p99)
with clusterScope: true. Satisfies ANLS-02 (configurable thresholds)
and ANLS-05 (SLO-based thresholds).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
operations.description: Commit Task 1 - progressive thresholds in demo rollout

operations.command:
cd /home/sam/.claude/progressive-deploy && git add examples/progressive-thresholds-example.yaml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
docs(examples): add progressive thresholds example documentation

Comprehensive examples for SLO-based analysis thresholds:

1. SLO threshold reference table (conservative/standard/aggressive)
2. Multi-metric analysis step (error-rate + latency + CPU)
3. Environment-specific behavior (staging pause vs production auto-rollback)
4. Per-service threshold override (critical vs non-critical paths)
5. Full 3-step progressive pattern template

All examples use production ClusterAnalysisTemplates with clusterScope: true.
Validates with kubectl dry-run.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
